business.headline: Gold, silver prices slip as rally cools: What should you do next?After a nine-week winning streak, gold and silver prices are finally losing steam as investors book profits amid a stronger dollar, easing global tensions, and anticipation over key US economic data.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as FMCG stocks offset metal gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 96.63 points to 84,459.77, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 24.20 points to 25,866.45 as of 9:28 am.

Midwest listing today: Will it give investors profit? See what GMP suggestsMidwest IPO was subscribed 92.36 times overall. The retail portion was booked 25.52 times, the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category saw 146.99 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category was subscribed 176.57 times.

Banks to allow up to four nominees per account from November 1. Check detailsThe decision to allow four nominees aims to make the claim settlement process smoother, more transparent, and uniform across all banks in the country.

Gold, silver prices rebound amid volatility. Will they rise today?Following a rough start earlier this week, gold and silver staged a mild recovery on Thursday. While the recovery lifted market mood, the outlook for today depends on global data and investor sentiment.

Apple loses UK lawsuit over App Store's unfair 30% developer commissionsApple has been found guilty in a London court for abusing its dominant position by charging app developers an unfair 30 per cent commission on its App Store. The ruling marks a significant legal challenge against the tech giant's business practices in the UK market.

Dreamliner aircraft saw 31 faulty deployment of emergency turbine in 14 yearsBoeing's Dreamliner aircraft reported 31 instances of faulty deployment of Ram Air Turbine, which is deployed automatically in the eventuality of a dual engine failure or total electric or hydraulic failure.

Wasting your credit card reward points? Here's how to track and redeem smartlyMost people use their credit cards daily but forget one key benefit — reward points. These points can fetch you free flights, hotel stays, or cashback, but only if tracked and redeemed wisely. Here's how to make every swipe count.
Sensex ends 130 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 130.06 points to end at 84,556.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 22.80 points to close at 25,891.40.

HUL shares rise nearly 3% after Q2 results and dividend announcementHUL shares have been on a steady uptrend in recent months. Over the last six months, the stock has gained 8.03%, while it has risen 3.81% in the past month and 1.84% in the last five trading sessions.

Is your savings account on tax radar? 7 bank transactions that raise red flagsYour savings account might not be as private as you think. Certain transactions can draw the tax department's attention and trigger scrutiny.

Oil prices surge 3% as India rethinks Russian crude purchases: ReportIndia, which has been the largest buyer of discounted Russian oil since 2022, imported around 1.7 million barrels per day in the first nine months of this year. However, the latest sanctions could now force Indian companies to shift to other suppliers.

Gold and Silver prices today: Check rates, future outlook, key support levelsGold and silver prices fell after record highs as investors booked profits. Easing geopolitical risks, a stronger dollar, and US–India trade optimism weigh, though long-term trends remain bullish.

Bitcoin stuck around $108K. Is the crypto rally fading?Bitcoin, the world's largest and most popular cryptocurrency, has slipped by nearly 1.94% over the past week and was trading around $108,922 at the time of writing. Ethereum, its closest rival, also fell by 3.57% in the same period.
Did Trump get this one right? Report claims India to slash Russian oil buysThe country's top private buyer of Russian oil, plans to significantly cut or completely halt its crude imports from Moscow.

Infosys, HCLTech, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?Infosys, HCLTech, and TCS stocks rallied today on the BSE and NSE, driven by India–US trade optimism, Infosys' record buyback, strong Q2 earnings expectations, and renewed investor confidence.

ITR refund still pending? Check your status online and know the reasons for delayWhile many taxpayers have already received their refunds, a few are still waiting for the amount to reach their bank accounts. If you haven't received yours yet, here's how you can track your refund online and find out what might be causing the delay.

Sensex, Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs: Will festive rally continue on Dalal Street?Sensex and Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs, fueled by festive optimism, trade deal hopes, and strong domestic and FII inflows. Key sectors like IT, pharma, and textiles are leading gains.

Gold, silver prices crash: Why are the precious metals under pressure?Gold and silver metals, which hit record highs earlier, have started to decline as investors book profits and shift back to assets such as equities.

Infosys shares rise over 4% today: What's driving the rally?Infosys shares jumped 3.2% to Rs 1,519.75 after announcing a record Rs 18,000 crore buyback. Promoters abstaining boosted investor sentiment, driving IT stock gains and strong market interest today.

entertainment.headline: Johnny Depp to star in 'Ebenezer: A Christmas Carol' for Paramount: Report Johnny Depp is close to securing the lead in Paramount Pictures' new version of 'A Christmas Carol', directed by Ti West. If confirmed, the film is scheduled for release in November 2026.

Alia Bhatt's Chamunda casting: Director Amar Kaushik breaks silence on rumours Director Amar Kaushik clarified that there's no confirmation yet on Alia Bhatt joining Chamunda, adding that story always comes before casting. He said the Maddock Horror Comedy Universe will continue blending folklore, humour, and scares while striving to raise the bar with each new film.

SRK almost played N Mallik in Company; Ajay Devgn replaced him, RGV explains why Ram Gopal Varma revealed that he initially offered Shah Rukh Khan the role of N Mallik in 'Company' but felt Ajay Devgn's calm style suited the character better, leading to his casting.

Thamma box office Day 3: Ayushmann's film crawls into Rs 50-crore club Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna's film Thamma has collected Rs 55 crore in India after three days. The horror-comedy's strong start reflects high festive turnout and sustained audience interest.

Crime 101 trailer: Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo in high-octane heist thriller Amazon MGM Studios has unveiled the first trailer for 'Crime 101', a high-octane crime thriller starring Chris Hemsworth and Halle Berry. Set to release in February 2026, the film teases an action-packed heist drama exploring moral conflicts against the backdrop of Los Angeles.

Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat box office Day 3: Harshvardhan's film crosses Rs 22 crore 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', starring Harshvardhan Rane and Sonam Bajwa, has crossed Rs 22 crore in its first three days at the box office despite clashing with 'Thamma'.

Vivek Oberoi joins Prabhas-Sandeep Vanga's Spirit, teases 'one bad habit' Actor Vivek Oberoi confirmed his participation in Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film 'Spirit' starring Prabhas. The audio story of 'Spirit' was launched on Prabhas' birthday, revealing key cast details.

Guns N' Roses' Axl Rose loses cool on stage, band blames technical glitch During their Buenos Aires concert, Guns N' Roses frontman Axl Rose faced a technical glitch with his in-ear monitor, leading to a brief on-stage outburst that quickly went viral. The band later clarified it was a technical issue, praising new drummer Isaac Carpenter and dismissing rumours of any internal tension.

Yuzvendra Chahal's sister shares emotional note for him amid Dhanashree's remarks Yuzvendra Chahal's sister Kenaa Dwivedi shared a heartfelt Bhai Dooj note praising her brother's dignity and silence amid tough times, which many saw as an indirect dig at his ex-wife Dhanashree Verma. Her post came soon after Dhanashree opened up about their marriage and split during her stint on 'Rise and Fall'.

Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh indulge in cheesy roleplay in new Abu Dhabi ad Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh feature in a lighthearted Abu Dhabi tourism campaign marking their anniversary. The commercial shows the couple engaging in humorous roleplay, referencing different genres and themes.

Ram Charan, Upasana are expecting twins, confirms Shobana Kamineni Ram Charan and Upasana Konidela are expecting twins, as confirmed by Upasana's mother, Shobana Kamineni. The announcement was made on social media during the couple's Diwali celebrations and baby shower.

Bhediya meets Betaal: Thamma's blood-curdling twist that rewrites MDHCU's history 'Thamma' redefines Maddock's entire horror-comedy universe. The Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna starrer connects directly to 'Bhediya' and 'Stree', revealing a shocking twist that binds Ayushmann's Betaal and Varun Dhawan's Bhediya in a deadly pact.

Kim Kardashian's London look draws Bianca Censori-style comparisons Kim Kardashian appeared at the London premiere of 'All's Fair', changing outfits during the event. Her sheer corset ensemble drew comparisons to Bianca Censori, Kanye West's current wife.

BB19 Episode 61: Nehal-Farrhana drift apart, Ashnoor-Mridul's banter turns messy Final heartbreak hits the 'Bigg Boss 19' house as a shocking betrayal fractures the Nehal-Farrhana bond. Meanwhile, the escalating Neelam-Tanya conflict ends in tears, and one prank pushes Ashnoor and Mridul past the fun.

Taylor Swift, LL Cool J, Kenny Loggins lead 2026 Songwriters Hall nominees Taylor Swift, LL Cool J, Kenny Loggins, and David Byrne lead the 2026 Songwriters Hall of Fame nominations. The ballot includes notable names from pop, hip-hop, rock, country, and R&B genres.

9-1-1: Nashville star Isabelle Tate dies at 23, battling neuromuscular disease Isabelle Tate, actor from' 9-1-1: Nashville', has died at age 23. She was diagnosed with a rare progressive neuromuscular disease at 13.

Michael B Jordan in talks to lead Joseph Kosinski's Miami Vice reboot Universal Pictures schedules new 'Miami Vice' film adaptation for August 2027.  The film is inspired by the original 1980s television series' pilot and first season.

Outer Banks co-creator Jonas Pate accused of assaulting female assistant Jonas Pate, co-creator of 'Outer Banks', allegedly grabbed, shook, and shouted at a female production assistant during filming in Croatia. Actor Chase Stokes intervened, followed by Madelyn Cline, to defuse the situation on set.

KPop Demon Hunters' Huntr/x to make concert debut at KIIS-FM's Jingle Ball The 'KPop Demon Hunters' singing group, Huntr/x, will perform their first live concert at KIIS-FM's Jingle Ball 2025. The soundtrack and its song 'Golden' have achieved significant chart success in the US.

general news.headline: 20 killed as Hyderabad-Bengaluru bus hits bike, catches fire in AndhraAt least 20 people were killed after a Hyderabad–Bengaluru bus caught fire following a collision with a two-wheeler in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool district.

Piyush Pandey, legendary adman known for Fevicol, Vodafone pug campaigns, dies at 70From Cadbury's 'Kuch Khaas Hai' and Asian Paints' 'Har Khushi Mein Rang Laye' to Vodafone's iconic pug ad, Piyush Pandey's ideas became ingrained in Indian pop culture. His slogan "Ab ki baar, Modi sarkar," created for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 2014 election campaign, also went on to become a widely recognised political catchphrase.

After India, Afghanistan set to restrict river water to PakistanAfter India's suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, Afghanistan is now moving to curb Pakistan's access to water from cross-border rivers. The Taliban's Supreme Leader has said that Kabul will build a dam on the Kunar River as soon as possible, just weeks after Afghanistan and Pakistan engaged in a war in which hundreds were killed.

Delhi air quality stations check reveals faulty displays, hidden or dead monitorsDelhi has dozens of air monitoring stations meant to provide live updates on city's air quality for citizens. But India Today's on-ground verification found several either hidden, dysfunctional, or incorrectly placed.

Elon Musk vs Trump's Nasa chief: The tug-of-war that could kill NasaThe antagonism reached a peak when Duffy, who also serves as Transportation Secretary, publicly stated that Musk's SpaceX was "behind schedule" on the critical Artemis III project, designed to land U.S. astronauts back on the Moon.

Speak Marathi in Mumbai or...: Woman threatens YouTuber on Air India flightA YouTuber was threatened by a co-passenger for not speaking Marathi on an Air India flight. The incident has sparked widespread debate on linguistic intolerance and regional chauvinism in Maharashtra.

If she's a 10, you're an asset: Elon Musk on 'sex warfare' in Silicon ValleyThe Times reported that attractive Chinese and Russian spies are infiltrating US tech companies by seducing employees to steal trade secrets. Tech magnate Elon Musk reacted to the report in his usual memelord style.

EU sanctions three Indian firms for alleged links to Russia's war industryThe European Union sanctioned three Indian firms in its latest package targeting entities accused of aiding Russia's military industry, alleging they helped bypass export curbs on high-tech defence equipment.

How treachery helped Pakistan wedge itself between neighbours India, AfghanistanWhile Afghanistan and Pakistan were engaged in a war this month, an image showing an India-Afghanistan border pillar from the 1930s went viral. India and Afghanistan shared a small land border through the Wakhan Corridor before Pakistan wedged itself in through treachery and the illegal occupation of Gilgit-Baltistan in 1947.

Maharana Raj Singh, Aurangzeb's tyranny, and the great Shrinathji idol rescueIt was 1671 when Mewar's Maharana Raj Singh openly defied Mughal emperor Aurangzeb by vowing to protect Shrinathji's idol at any cost, even if it meant the ruin of the city. The idol had been moved from Mathura to Rajasthan by Vaishnava devotees seeking to escape persecution by the Mughal ruler — a defining act of Rajput resistance.

German firm promotes crane used by thieves in Louvre heist with mock adThe spectacular heist, which took place in broad daylight on Sunday and also one of several to target French museums in recent months, forced the closure of the Louvre, the world's most-visited museum and home to the Mona Lisa.

How fear hijacks your brain during scam calls and ways to stay rationalScam calls exploit the brain's fear response to trigger panic and irrational decisions. Mindfulness and awareness can help individuals regain control and avoid falling victim.

Deepika Padukone, Ranveer Singh indulge in cheesy roleplay in new Abu Dhabi adDeepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh feature in a lighthearted Abu Dhabi tourism campaign marking their anniversary. The commercial shows the couple engaging in humorous roleplay, referencing different genres and themes.

Gold, silver prices rebound amid volatility. Will they rise today?Following a rough start earlier this week, gold and silver staged a mild recovery on Thursday. While the recovery lifted market mood, the outlook for today depends on global data and investor sentiment.

Jobs, free power: Mahagathbandhan likely to unveil poll manifesto on October 28The Mahagathbandhan's election manifesto will combine Tejashwi Yadav's key promises, including jobs and livelihoods for every household, with the Congress's pledges, such as 200 units of free electricity and subsidised gas cylinders.

Egregious behaviour: Trump cancels trade talks with Canada over 'fake' tariff adTrump wrote on Truth Social that Canada had run an advert featuring former President Ronald Reagan speaking negatively about tariffs, calling it "egregious behaviour".

Rohit's most un-Rohit 73 in Adelaide is his strongest 2027 World Cup statement yetAUS vs IND, 2nd ODI Rohit Sharma's 73 in Adelaide was far from graceful, yet every run carried purpose. Battling pace, bounce, and scrutiny, he showed resilience and intent, proving that even un-Rohit innings can signal his readiness for the challenges leading to the 2027 World Cup.

Your grandpa came from India: Mehdi Hasan counters Nikki Haley's son on migrationNalin Haley, son of Republican leader Nikki Haley, has sparked controversy on social media after calling for an end to mass immigration. He also urged states to restrict H-1B visas. British-American journalist Mehdi Hasan countered, saying Haley's grandfather, Ajit Randhawa, had migrated from India to the US in 1969.

Chinese doctors transplant pig liver into human. He lived for 171 daysThe 71-year-old patient, who underwent the surgery in May at the First Affiliated Hospital of Anhui Medical University, survived for 171 days after the procedure.

Men evolved. The older generation didn't get the upgradeEvery time you leave the male circle to pitch in with chores, do you get odd looks? Don't be so surprised, older generations find it hard to accept the changing face of modern men.

Bhediya meets Betaal: Thamma's blood-curdling twist that rewrites MDHCU's history'Thamma' redefines Maddock's entire horror-comedy universe. The Ayushmann Khurrana and Rashmika Mandanna starrer connects directly to 'Bhediya' and 'Stree', revealing a shocking twist that binds Ayushmann's Betaal and Varun Dhawan's Bhediya in a deadly pact.

Man dies by suicide, was depressed as wife was living separately after disputeA 35-year-old man from Goregaon East, Mumbai, was found hanging at his residence. Police said he was living separately from his wife following a marital dispute.

Crime 101 trailer: Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo in high-octane heist thrillerAmazon MGM Studios has unveiled the first trailer for 'Crime 101', a high-octane crime thriller starring Chris Hemsworth and Halle Berry. Set to release in February 2026, the film teases an action-packed heist drama exploring moral conflicts against the backdrop of Los Angeles.

Indian man faces 15 years in jail for stealing $50k while moonlighting in New YorkA 39-year-old Indian-origin man, who was an employee at the New York State Office of Information Technology, was arrested for allegedly simultaneously working in another job. Authorities claimed that Mehul Goswami's actions led to a theft of more than $50,000 in state funds.

sports.headline: Smriti Mandhana is outstanding, glad I don't have to deal with her: Sophie Devine Women's World Cup: Sophie Devine said she is relieved to retire without facing Smriti Mandhana again, praising the Indian batter's record-breaking form and noting that she will continue to improve.

How Colombo rain ruined Sophie Devine's farewell Women's World Cup campaign Sophie Devine's farewell World Cup ended in frustration as New Zealand fell 53 runs short against India, officially knocking the White Ferns out. Part poor form, part Colombo's merciless rain, the campaign was sabotaged by abandoned matches against Pakistan and Sri Lanka, leaving points shared and hopes dashed.

Kuldeep Yadav a must for 3rd ODI vs AUS, can't keep adding batters: Parthiv Patel Former India batter Parthiv Patel urges inclusion of Kuldeep Yadav in Sydney ODI. He says India must balance batting with spin options to take crucial wickets and strengthen their middle overs against Australia.

Virat Kohli must not bat desperately for runs vs AUS after 2 ducks: Irfan Pathan Irfan Pathan urges Virat Kohli to remain calm after back-to-back ducks in Perth and Adelaide. He advises Kohli not to force runs and to enjoy batting, saying form will return naturally with patience.

Pratika Rawal channels inner psychologist to give India fresh hopes Women's World Cup, IND vs NZ: A student of psychology, Pratika Rawal scored 122 runs against New Zealand on Thursday, helping India secure their place in the semi-finals.

Rohit's most un-Rohit 73 in Adelaide is his strongest 2027 World Cup statement yet AUS vs IND, 2nd ODI Rohit Sharma's 73 in Adelaide was far from graceful, yet every run carried purpose. Battling pace, bounce, and scrutiny, he showed resilience and intent, proving that even un-Rohit innings can signal his readiness for the challenges leading to the 2027 World Cup.

Centurion Pratika Rawal explains her success mantra, gives update on Richa's injury Women's World Cup: After producing a near-perfect game with her all-round performance against New Zealand, India opener Pratika Rawal explained her success mantra while crediting the calm dressing room and support from her parents.

Bl**dy frustrating: Sophie Devine gutted after New Zealand exit Women's World Cup Sophie Devine lamented New Zealand's rain-hit Women's World Cup campaign, which ended with a 53-run DLS loss to India, despite strong individual performances from Brooke Halliday and Izzy Gaze.

Semi-final spot sealed, Harmanpreet Kaur hopes India can iron out bowling flaws Women's World Cup: Captain Harmanpreet Kaur breathed a sigh of relief as India clinched the fourth spot in the semi-finals with a dominant victory over New Zealand, while noting that the team still had to sharpen its bowling before the knockout rounds.

Smriti Mandhana surprised with POTM award vs NZ: Pratika deserved it as much as me Smriti Mandhana said she was surprised to see her win the Player Of The Match award, saying that Pratika Rawal also deserved it as much as her after beating New Zealand. The Indian opening pair setup India's win with their hundreds.

Mandhana, Rawal masterclass powers India into semis, blows away New Zealand Women's World Cup: Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal lit up Navi Mumbai with blistering centuries as India snapped their three-match losing streak and stormed into the semi-finals of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 with a commanding 53-run win over New Zealand.

Centurion Pratika Rawal explains her success mantra, gives update on Richa's injury Women's World Cup: After producing a near-perfect game with her all-round performance against New Zealand, India opener Pratika Rawal explained her success mantra while crediting the calm dressing room and support from her parents.

Bl**dy frustrating: Sophie Devine gutted after New Zealand exit Women's World Cup Sophie Devine lamented New Zealand's rain-hit Women's World Cup campaign, which ended with a 53-run DLS loss to India, despite strong individual performances from Brooke Halliday and Izzy Gaze.

Semi-final spot sealed, Harmanpreet Kaur hopes India can iron out bowling flaws Women's World Cup: Captain Harmanpreet Kaur breathed a sigh of relief as India clinched the fourth spot in the semi-finals with a dominant victory over New Zealand, while noting that the team still had to sharpen its bowling before the knockout rounds.

Smriti Mandhana surprised with POTM award vs NZ: Pratika deserved it as much as me Smriti Mandhana said she was surprised to see her win the Player Of The Match award, saying that Pratika Rawal also deserved it as much as her after beating New Zealand. The Indian opening pair setup India's win with their hundreds.

Mandhana, Rawal masterclass powers India into semis, blows away New Zealand Women's World Cup: Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal lit up Navi Mumbai with blistering centuries as India snapped their three-match losing streak and stormed into the semi-finals of the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup 2025 with a commanding 53-run win over New Zealand.

Shreyas Iyer lifts the lid on his decision to take break from red-ball cricketAustralia vs India: Shreyas Iyer broke his silence on taking a break from red-ball cricket following India's narrow two-wicket defeat to Australia in the second ODI.

Lionel Messi extends Inter Miami stay, signs new contract till 2028Lionel has extended his stay with Inter Miami, signing a new contract with the club until 2028. Messi has led the club from the front since joining them in 2023 and is hoping to play at their new stadium.

Hope Agarkar, BCCI has informed Sarfaraz Khan why he was dropped: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar hopes that Sarfaraz Khan got clarity from Chief selector Ajit Agarkar and the rest of the selection committee as to why he is out of the national team setup at the moment. Sarfaraz last played for India during the New Zealand home series in 2024.

Bangladesh spin their way to 2-1 series win over West IndiesBangladesh spun a web around West Indies, crushing them by 179 runs in the third ODI to claim their first series victory since March last year. A scintillating 176-run opening partnership between Saif Hassan and Soumya Sarkar laid the foundation for Bangladesh's 296 for 8, leaving the visitors reeling as they were bowled out for just 117 in 30.1 overs.

AUS vs IND: Shreyas Iyer admits series loss hurts but praises Australian battersIndia batter Shreyas Iyer admitted that the ODI series loss was painful but heaped praise on Australia's middle-order batters, who anchored their side to a narrow two-wicket victory in the second One-Day International at Adelaide Oval on Thursday. Iyer also noted that Australia's ability to make the most of bowler-friendly conditions helped them take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Virat Kohli hasn't given any signal, won't retire after 2 ducks: Sunil GavaskarBatting great Sunil Gavaskar said people should not read too much into Virat Kohli's glove gesture in Adelaide, adding that the star batter is not the type to call it quits after just two back-to-back ducks in the ongoing three-match ODI series against Australia.

Rohit Sharma's patient, composed innings in Adelaide ODI pleases Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar praised Rohit Sharma for adapting to the situation and playing a patient, composed innings during the Adelaide ODI. After starting off slowly, Rohit scored 73 off 97 balls and was India's best player on the day.

How a technical tweak helped Shreyas Iyer prepare for Australia tourAfter a gritty 66 at Adelaide Oval, India batter Shreyas Iyer revealed that reverting to an upright batting stance has helped him regain both confidence and consistency.

AUS vs IND: Shreyas Iyer admits series loss hurts but praises Australian battersIndia batter Shreyas Iyer admitted that the ODI series loss was painful but heaped praise on Australia's middle-order batters, who anchored their side to a narrow two-wicket victory in the second One-Day International at Adelaide Oval on Thursday. Iyer also noted that Australia's ability to make the most of bowler-friendly conditions helped them take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the series.

Virat Kohli hasn't given any signal, won't retire after 2 ducks: Sunil GavaskarBatting great Sunil Gavaskar said people should not read too much into Virat Kohli's glove gesture in Adelaide, adding that the star batter is not the type to call it quits after just two back-to-back ducks in the ongoing three-match ODI series against Australia.

After starting off slowly, Rohit scored 73 off 97 balls and was India's best player on the day.

How a technical tweak helped Shreyas Iyer prepare for Australia tourAfter a gritty 66 at Adelaide Oval, India batter Shreyas Iyer revealed that reverting to an upright batting stance has helped him regain both confidence and consistency.

Azhar Mahmood slams Pakistan's poor batting in Rawalpindi Test lossPAK vs SA, 2nd Test: Head coach Azhar Mahmood said Pakistan's recurring batting collapses cost them an eight-wicket defeat to South Africa at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium, leaving the series tied 1-1.

Sunil Gavaskar Exclusive: India Vs Australia | Two Cheap Dismissals For Virat KohliOn this special report, the focus is on Virat Kohli's form after he registered his first-ever back-to-back ducks in his ODI career during the series against Australia. Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar states, 'Come on, he's allowed a couple of failures. Don't read too much into what has happened.' The discussion also delves into Rohit Sharma's confident return to form with a crucial 70-plus score, his future in the ODI squad following his removal as captain, and the controversial non-selection of domestic run-machine Sarfaraz Khan, despite his consistent performances. Gavaskar provides his expert analysis on the challenges of batting on Australian pitches and the approach the senior players should take moving forward.

Message for Virat Kohli? R Ashwin's cryptic post sparks fan speculationR Ashwin has created buzz on social media with his tweet after India's loss to Australia in Adelaide on Thursday, October 23. Many fans speculate that the message from Ashwin was for Virat Kohli.

Tilak recalls battle with life-threatening muscle disease, thanks Akash AmbaniAsia Cup hero Tilak Varma recounted his battle with rhabdomyolysis, a potentially life-threatening condition caused by rapid muscle breakdown. The Hyderabad star said Mumbai Indians co-owner Akash Ambani and the BCCI provided timely support during his recovery.

PBKS appoint Sairaj Bahutule as new spin bowling coach before IPL 2026Punjab Kings have announced Sairaj Bahutule as their new spin bowling coach, replacing Sunil Joshi ahead of the next IPL season. The move aims to reinforce PBKS's bowling strategy and further develop young talent as the team prepares for the upcoming IPL auction and 2026 campaign.

Retirement soon? Virat Kohli's gloves gesture after Adelaide duck sparks speculationAUS vs IND, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli raised his gloves to acknowledge the standing ovation from the Adelaide Oval crowd after being dismissed for a duck. While it appeared to be a poignant gesture following what could be his final international innings at one of his favourite hunting grounds, speculation over whether Kohli was hinting at retirement began swirling on social media on Thursday.

IND vs NZ: Pratika Rawal repays faith with maiden World Cup hundred, equals world recordPratika Rawal repaid the faith put in her by the Indian team management with a wonderful hundred against New Zealand in their Women's ODI World Cup clash in Navi Mumbai. Pratika also equalled a world record during her knock.

Rohit Sharma missed out on a big knock: Gill praises ex-captain's 73 vs AustraliaIndia captain Shubman Gill praised senior batter Rohit Sharma's gritty 73-run knock, adding that he felt the former captain missed out on a big score during India's loss to Australia in the second ODI of the three-match series at the Adelaide Oval.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.
